com.tradersgem2.stock

Class Stock

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tradersgem2.stock.Stock
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    StockMarketStock

    public class Stock
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
    This is the model for an individual stock. This class holds the information for an individual user stock, it holds such things stock id, stock name, price, date purchased, quantity, and if it is owned or it part of the watch list. This class is immutable and serialized.
    Author:
    pedro + Luiz
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.Object clone()
      Here we are overriding the clone object to allow for cloning of Stock; This is because one user may have multiple instances of the same stock with different data .
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
      Here we are overriding the equals method so to correctly check if the Object o is a similar instance of the the current Stock object; Since every purchase generates a unique id, we check for the id;
      int getId()
      Get the unique Id of the stock.

      Gets the unique Name of the stock
      boolean getOwnedStatus()
      Gets the owned status of the stock
      float getPrice()
      Gets the price of the stock
      java.util.Date getPurchaseDate()
      Gets the date that the stock was purchased
      int getQuantity()
      Gets the quantity of the stock that was purchased

    • Constructor Detail

      • Stock

        public Stock(int id,
     java.lang.String name,
     float price,
     java.util.Date date,
     int qty,
     boolean isOwned)
        Constructor for a stock.
        Parameters:
        id - - An integer representing the unique id of the stock.
        name - - A String representing the unique user name of the stock.
        price - - A float containing the individual unit price of one stock.
        date - - A date containing the purchase date of the stocks.
        qty - - A integer containing the quantity of the stock that was purchased.
        isOwned - - A boolean indicating if the stock is owned or it just on the watch list.

      • clone

        public java.lang.Object clone()
        Here we are overriding the clone object to allow for cloning of Stock; This is because one user may have multiple instances of the same stock with different data . For example purchases at different occasions.
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
        Here we are overriding the equals method so to correctly check if the Object o is a similar instance of the the current Stock object; Since every purchase generates a unique id, we check for the id;
